title: Infinite Cliques in Simple and Stable Graphs
authors: Yatir Halevi and Itay Kaplan and Saharon Shelah
abstract:
Suppose that $G$ is a graph of cardinality $\mu^+$ with chromatic number
$\chi(G)\geq \mu^+$. One possible reason that this could happen is if $G$
contains a clique of size $\mu^+$. We prove that this is indeed the case when
the edge relation is stable. When $G$ is a random graph (which is simple but
not stable), this is not true. But still if in general the complete theory of
$G$ is simple, $G$ must contain finite cliques of unbounded sizes.
